title: Which sentence is correct? Have you any idea? Or you have any idea? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your two sentences have question marks, so the constructions should be similar. The interrogative ‘have you’ is correct, but ‘you have any’ is a statement and could be replaced by ‘Do you have any?’ - which is what most people would say.
Out of those two, “Have you any idea?” is correct. I would personally phrase it “Do you have any idea?”
